Waypoints.Description:
t-CyCIF of a large resection specimen from a patient with pancreatic cancer. The entire sample comprising 143 stitched 10X fields of view is shown.

#### Figure from:

Lin JR, Izar B, Wang S, Yapp C, Mei S, Shah P, Santagata S, Sorger PK. Highly multiplexed immunofluorescence imaging of human tissues and tumors using t-CyCIF and conventional optical microscopes. eLife. 2018 Jul 11;7:e31657. PMID: 29993362
Waypoints.Name: The Waypoint
Small Intestine
Waypoints.Description: Small intestine which resected with PDAC, `PCNA` shows nice crypts and cilia are labeled strongly with `beta-catenin` (Red). Some representative images from the same region could be found in Figure 7C.

Waypoints.Name: PDAC Region
Waypoints.Description: PDAC are inflated with immune cells, labeled with `CD45` and `CD4`. Notably, this region also expressed highest `PD-L1`, eliciting a possible immune evasion mechanism. Corresponsive figures and data for Figure 8B-D.

Waypoints.Name: Normal Pancreas
Waypoints.Description: A co-resected normal pancreas show nice organization with EMT markers, `E-Cadherin` and `Vimentin` (red). Some representative images and data collected are in Figure 8B-D.
